comments.body: Are there situations where any of these would be needed without the others? Would it make sense to hide fine-grained options (`hide: !verbose`), and keep a non-hidden 'android' option?
We map each flag to individual `DevelopmentArtifact`. So, we would need another layer of indirection to map `android` to a group of `DevelopmentArtifact`.

If you get the `--android` flag, you can split it apart into `android_gen_snapshot`, `android_maven`, and `android_internal_build`. `--android` can be shown in help by default, `--android_gen_snapshot`, `--android_maven`, and `--android_internal_build` can be hidden unless `--verbose` is also given by passing `hide: !verbose` to `argParser.addFlag()`.

This is only needed if using the new `--android_`* flags individually is uncommon or only used by people working on the tool.
